Apply

Doximity is transforming the healthcare industry. Our mission is to help doctors be more productive, informed, and connected.¬†As a software engineer, you'll work within cross-functional delivery teams alongside other engineers, designers, and product managers in building software to help improve healthcare.¬†¬†\n\nOur [team](https://www.doximity.com/about/company#theteam)¬†brings a diverse set of technical and cultural backgrounds and we like to¬†think pragmatically in choosing the tools most appropriate for the job at hand.\n\n**Here's How You Will Make an Impact**\n\n* Help architect a distributed system that puts clinical knowledge, secure messaging, and professional connections at a doctor‚Äôs fingertips\n* Cache, optimize, and develop systems that can handle millions of operations per day\n* Work closely with our data science team to bring their insights into robust, real-time software\n* Advance our SMS and telephony platform which connects doctors and patients tens of thousands of times per day\n* Join a ‚Äústartup within a startup‚Äù and help us break into brand new industries\n* Help drive the product direction and change the landscape of medicine in the United States\n\n**About you**\n\n*One of Doximity's core values is about stretching ourselves and challenging assumptions. Even if you can't check off all the boxes below you're encouraged to apply. Talent and grit packaged with a unique perspective drives innovation. Doximity is full of exceptional people that don't fit a mold, join us!*\n\n* You have a strong software engineering background and are prepared to make high-quality contributions to modern, production web applications.¬†\n* You have a deep understanding of a dynamic, object-oriented programming language like Ruby, a web framework like Rails and a modern JavaScript framework like Vue.js.\n* You are a problem solver with a passion for simple, clean, and maintainable solutions\n* You test your code and appreciate the benefits tests offer\n* You have experience with web infrastructure, relational databases, distributed systems, and performance optimizations\n* You are self-motivated and able to manage yourself\n* You possess concise and effective written and verbal communication skills\n* You are able to maintain a minimum of 5 hours overlap with 9:30 to 5:30 PM Pacific time\n* You can dedicate about 18 days per year for travel to company events\n\n**Benefits & Perks**\n\n* Generous time off policy\n* Comprehensive benefits including medical, vision, dental, Life/ADD, 401k, flex spending accounts, commuter benefits, equipment budget, and continuous education budget\n* Pre-IPO stock incentives\n* .. and much more! For a full list, see our [career page](https://workat.doximity.com/)\n\n**About Us**\n\n* Here are some of the [ways we bring value to doctors](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qimYh0mG3i1nTJe6jDCDepJt2i4o8MEB/view)\n* Our¬†web applications are¬†built¬†primarily¬†using Ruby, Rails, Javascript (Vue.js), and¬†a bit of¬†Golang\n* Our data engineering stack run on Python, MySQL, Spark, and Airflow\n* Our production application stack is hosted on AWS and we deploy to production on average 50 times per day\n* We have over 350 private repositories in Github containing our applications, forks of gems, our own internal gems, and [open-source projects](https://github.com/doximity)\n* We have worked as a distributed team for a long time; we're currently [about 65% distributed](https://blog.brunomiranda.com/building-a-distributed-engineering-team-85d281b9b1c)\n* Find out more information on the Doximity [engineering blog](https://engineering.doximity.com/)\n* Our [company core values](https://work.doximity.com/)\n* Our [recruiting process](https://engineering.doximity.com/articles/engineering-recruitment-process-doximity)\n* Our [product development cycle](https://engineering.doximity.com/articles/mofo-driven-product-development)\n* Our [on-boarding & mentorship process](https://engineering.doximity.com/articles/software-engineering-on-boarding-at-doximity)\n\nWe‚Äôre thrilled to be named the[ Fastest Growing Company in the Bay Area](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/doximity-is-fastest-growing-company-in-bay-area-per-deloittes-2016-technology-fast-500-300367390.html), and one of [Fast Company‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies](https://www.fastcompany.com/most-innovative-companies/2018/sectors/social-media). Joining Doximity means being part of an incredibly talented and humble team. We work on amazing products that over 70% of US doctors (and over one million healthcare professionals) use to make their busy lives a little easier. We‚Äôre driven by the goal of improving inefficiencies in our $3.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system and love creating technology that has a real, meaningful impact on people‚Äôs lives. To learn more about our team, culture, and users, check out our careers page, company blog, and engineering blog. We‚Äôre growing steadily, and there‚Äôs plenty of opportunity for you to make an impact.\n\n*Doximity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.* \n\n#Salary\n$130,000\n \n\n#Location\n- North America

The Opportunity\nModern Tribe is looking for an experienced UI/Front End Developer to join our team as a freelance contractor.\n\nIf you have experience with advanced JavaScript, frameworks including React and React Native and want to apply those skills on top of a variety of delivery systems, from integrations with large scale WordPress installs to custom backend and server side rendered platforms you‚Äôre probably a good match for this role.\n\nYou will enjoy unique challenges and build hybrid app systems or complex interactive UI‚Äôs alongside other Front End/Back End Developers that will require deep collaboration with your team. Performance optimization and testing will be a required skill set, and knowledge of the latest asset bundling systems with optimal performance configuration for them will be key. You will also implement designs accurately with progressive css/templating methods and work with the rest of the team to identify reusable code proactively, abstracting that to internal tools as applicable.\n\nThis opportunity is for a person ready to challenge themselves with a diverse team on a wide range of JavaScript intensive projects. We foster a collaborative and engaging environment, and are looking for people who want to grow our systems with us as we create the best interfaces and experiences we can for our clients.\n\n# Responsibilities\n **Responsibilities**\n**ARCHITECT** Work to architect scalable and maintainable applications across a range of technologies.\n**COLLABORATE** Coordinate and communicate clearly and whenever needed with designers, back-end developers and other application devs\n**SOLVE** You will be presented with complex technical requirements and design robust solutions to fulfill them.\n\n**Location**\nWork from anywhere and join our distributed team working across the globe. If your timezone is outside of US business hours, but you work at least 3-4+ hours of overlap each day, let‚Äôs chat. You should be fluent in English and just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily video chats with the Tribe.\n\n**Compensation**\nPay range is commensurate with qualifications and experience between $40-$65/hour. We are currently looking for freelance contractors about 10-20 hours a week for this gig.\n\n**Perks**\nWe believe that distributed working is a way of life. We understand what it means to work remotely. We offer consistency in expectations, payment, and support. We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us.\n\n(Also, if you work enough with us, we‚Äôll bring you on the team trips.) \n\n# Requirements\n**Personal Competencies**\n* Strong communication skills\n* Experience working as part of a remote team\n* Self-motivated, detail-oriented\n* Strong organizational skills\n* A methodical approach to all tasks\n* Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines\n* Fluent English speaker\n\n**Knowledge & Experience**\n* Extensive knowledge of modern JavaScript standards and patterns\n* Experience with React and/or React Native\n* Proficiency at local environment setup for app development, docker\n* Experience with REST APIs\n* Experience with async operations at scale and modern practices to handle them\n* Advanced experience with state management\n* Solid understanding of various styling approaches for UI Development (CSS Modules, Styled * Components etc)\n* Unit, snapshot and integration testing\n* GIT\n\n**Bonus Points**\n* Examples of plugins / code that you‚Äôve released to the open source community\n* Experience with WordPress\n* Experience with GraphQL\n* Native app development (android, ios)\n\n**Who We Are**\nModern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world‚Äôs largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).\n\n**Inclusion Statement**\nModern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.\n\nWe come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80‚Äôs movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.\n\nEveryday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.\n\n**Who You Are**\nWe love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:\n\n* **HAPPY** Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.\n* **HELPFUL** Always looking for ways that you can help others.\n* **CURIOUS** It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.\n* **ACCOUNTABLE** Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.\n \n\n#Salary\n$100,000\n \n\n#Location\n- üåèWorldwide

See more jobs at Modern Tribe

Director Of Security Engineering

Apply

\nAre you a technical leader who is passionate about security and enabling a team of highly talented security engineers in their mission to make Redox the most trusted name in healthcare technology?\n\nThe Redox Security Team\n\nThe Redox Security Team is building the foundation for our company to safely and efficiently eliminate the barriers to the adoption of technology in healthcare. We support teams throughout the company to enable them to build components that can securely store and transmit health data, thus enabling our customers to rapidly build and deploy products to change the face of the healthcare industry.\n\nYour Impact in this Role\n\nAs a Director of Security Engineering, you will oversee critical security programs that directly support building our secure healthcare platform. These programs include Application Security, Cloud Security, Identity & Access Management and Corporate Security. You will be responsible for coaching engineers in these functions and managing our strategic relationships across the technical and operational teams they work with.  We are all patients, and your role will be to ensure the safety of the data of yourself, your loved ones, and everyone else’s flowing through our platform. Our mission at Redox is to make health data useful, and you would focus on how to ensure that this mission isn’t undermined by interference from bad actors or flaws in the design of the environment. \n\nAbout You:\n\n\n* You prioritize building and supporting a diverse and inclusive team of engineers.\n\n* You are a leader who is able to elicit support without direct authority across the company.\n\n* You maintain relationships with key stakeholders and allies. \n\n* You are an exceptional coach, supporting your direct reports in achieving their goals and progressing their careers. \n\n* You hold yourself and your team accountable to goals and deliverables.\n\n* You maintain strong technical capabilities and use these to influence your overall security engineering strategy.\n\n* Rather than find solutions you help your teams find them themselves.\n\n* Be a sponsor and vigorous champion for your teams’ initiatives, including removing roadblocks for them when needed.\n\n* You draw from your experience to anticipate risks, and solve for future problems before they jeopardize your team. \n\n* Coordinate roadmaps across security, engineering and operation functions to ensure our plans are in sync, we have dependencies identified and are working towards common goals. \n\n* You have strongly honed communication and organizational skills.\n\n\n\n\nWork Experience and Expertise Should Include:\n\n\n* Experience leading technical engineering teams.\n\n* Knowledge of cloud-native and modern technologies (AWS, NodeJS, *nix, OSX, etc).\n\n* Familiarity of security practices, processes, and systems.\n\n* Affinity for an engineering culture that emphasizes Agile, DevOps, and continuous delivery.\n\n* Deep understanding of threat models for large, high-scale production platforms.\n\n* Strong communication and organizational skills.\n\n* Technical Security certification is nice to have.\n\n\n\n\nBonus Points\n\n\n* A history of building high performing technical security teams. \n\n\n

The Opportunity\nModern Tribe, is looking for a Senior Backend Developer with advanced WordPress experience to join our team. Do you have a near encyclopedic knowledge of what was included in the last few major WordPress releases? Could you go toe to toe in a WordPress coding standard battle? Do you dream in WordPress? We want to meet you!\n\nThe Backend developer gig at Modern Tribe will offer you the opportunity to become a leader within our tribe. You will be helping to build and inspire an awesome dev team working on innovative and large scale WordPress installations. We are looking for a backend developer that is already actively working in the WordPress website and plugin development field. You need to be up to speed and knowledgeable about the most recent releases and standards of WordPress. We want you to be as excited and as passionate as we are about what we are creating with the platform.\n\nExperienced WordPress developers only!\n\n# Responsibilities\n As a Senior WordPress Backend Developer at Modern Tribe, some of your key responsibilities will be:\n\n* Collaborate with the project strategist to articulate the best technological solution for the problem at hand\n* Analyze user story acceptance criteria to ensure the technical feasibility and point out potential issues\n* Work with a team of developers to deliver on time, on budget and on scope\n* Architect and develop broadly compatible new products, features, and bug fixes with consideration for accessibility, performance, and multilingual installations\n* Write high quality code with readability, efficiency and maintainability in mind\n* Develop and maintain complex WordPress-based applications\n* Implement complex features using modern PHP code and patterns while following standards\n* Code review the work of other developers\n* Improve our internal tools, libraries and standards\n* Actively participate in our scrum meetings\n* Work with the team to diagnose and resolve backend bugs and support requests\n* Mentor junior developers\n\n**Compensation**\nPay range is between $50-$80 USD per hour commensurate with qualifications and experience. For this gig we are looking for both Full Time hires and freelance contract roles of 15-20 hours per week of work.\n\n**Location**\nWork from anywhere and join our distributed team working across the globe. If your timezone is outside of US business hours, but you work at least 4+ hours of overlap each day, let‚Äôs chat. You should be fluent in English and just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily video chats with the Tribe.\n\n**Perks**\nWe believe that freelancing is a way of life. We understand what it means to be a freelancer. We offer consistency in expectations, payment, and support. We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us.\n\n**Who We Are**\n Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world‚Äôs largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).\n\nModern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.\n\nWe come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80‚Äôs movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.\n\nEveryday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.\n\n**Who You Are**\nWe love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:\n\n* **HAPPY** Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.\n* **HELPFUL** Always looking for ways that you can help others.\n* **CURIOUS** It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.\n* **ACCOUNTABLE** Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success. \n\n# Requirements\n**Personal Competencies**\n* Strong communication skills\n* Experience working as part of a remote team\n* Self-motivated, detail-oriented\n* Strong organizational skills\n* A methodical approach to all tasks\n* Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and complete tasks in a timely manner\n* Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines\n* Ability to work remotely with little-to-no supervision is a must\n* Excited to be part of a team with the potential for a long term relationship\n* Fluent English speaker\n\n**Knowledge & Experience**\n* 3-5 years experience working as a backend web developer on production sites\n* 3+ years experience working on WordPress sites\n* Extensive experience implementing complex WordPress sites\n* Skilled at crafting modern PHP\n* A comprehensive understanding of what it takes to write secure and performant code\n* Thorough knowledge of WordPress, PHP and MySQL\n* Excellent understanding of OOP, software development life cycle and better practices\n* Experience working with at least one automated testing framework\n\n**Bonus Points**\n* Experience with continuous integration and automated deployment pipelines\n* Unit Testing\n* Experience with WPML\n* Experience with server technologies like Redis or ElasticSearch\n* Remote work experience \n\n#Salary\n85,000\n \n\n#Location\n- üåèWorldwide

See more jobs at Modern Tribe

Also always verify you're actually talking to the company in the job post and not an imposter. Scams in remote work are rampant, be careful! \nJob description\n\n\nWe don’t just collect data, we connect data.\n\n We have the best data and the best tools. We continuously challenge conventional approaches to market research, and we disrupt our industry to ensure that our clients always get the best solutions.\n\nYouGov is an international data and analytics group. Our core offering of opinion data is derived from our highly participative panel of 8 million people worldwide, with 33 million interactions and billions of data points. We combine this continuous stream of data with our deep research expertise and broad industry experience into a systematic research and marketing platform. We have 36 offices in 22 countries and panel members in 44 countries.\n\n Our values are to be fast, fearless, get it right and trust each other.\n\nYougov is searching for a Remote Python Developer to collaborate building a modern and large-scale cloud-based analytics platform built for the web, entirely in Python.\n\nWhat will I be doing?\n\n\n* Working on the data transformation and transmitting the data, making assurances about the integrity of it\n\n* Our data flows handle more than 30 million data points every week, you will be central on the delivery of that data to our analytics team\n\n* Work primarily on backend, middleware and databases but everyone in the team regularly works on the full stack.\n\n* Optimization on memory management and speed is crucial given the scale and speed we want to bring to our platforms and clients.\n\n\n\n\nWhat do I need to bring with me?\n\n\n* 4+ years’ experience of Python web-based development\n\n* Experience using CherryPy, Flask or similar framework\n\n* Basic understanding of MongoDB, Django & PostgreSQL\n\n* Understanding of TDD methodology\n\n* An interest in ETL\n\n\n\n\n Additional Info…\n\nThis is a full time, permanent remote role, which can be based in any worldwide YouGov Office or any remote location throughout the US or Europe. We are a global team with developers on US central and east coast, and European hours too. Our only requirement time-wise is to attend an online daily meeting to report on your assignments.

\nWhats the Big Opportunity? \nWe're looking for a razor-sharp user-oriented UX developer to lead the front-end coding of our new flagship e-commerce website and app to launch our new brand as we sunset our 8yr-old previous brand. \nYou will 100% own the front-end development of both of these efforts while collaborating with our fully-remote team of 80+ as we jointly build a state-of-the-art B2C e-commerce platform & brand all from the comfort of your own home for a rapidly scaling, profitable, multiple 8-figure company. \nIn addition, you will be the internal leader who develops the vision and strategies to leverage the latest and most appropriate in front-end technologies to deliver fast, engaging, smooth, reliable and innovative user experiences. \nYes, we need someone who can carve up mock-ups but were looking for so much more. We want to tap into your creative problem solving brain to improve overall usability to smartly leverage technology to make everything faster, more scalable, smoother, and easier. \nWere fully hitting our stride in the exploding $250+ billion health and wellness field. And this is your chance to help make a meaningful impact on the lives of people who struggle with their health by accelerating our ability to penetrate this market with our robust product offerings (see more below). \nIf youre addicted to the satisfaction that comes from grinding away to perfect your code, and \n * You LOVE spending hours meticulously turning PSDs into pixel-perfect executions\n * You LOVE taking a holistic approach with heavy user focus, inclusive of UX and UI thinking\n * You LOVE developing projects the RIGHT way, with clean, tested, well-document code\n * You LOVE figuring out how to create fast-loading websites and apps with the latest tech\n * You LOVE to think about your work (and not just do as told) to creatively solve problems\n \n \nThen please read on as youre the ideal candidate and wed love to talk to you ASAP. \nTo summarize the key points: \n * Salary: $75,000 - $125,000\n * Location: 100% Remote (virtual team of 80+ with no corporate office)\n * Benefits: Full Insurance (health, dental & long-term disability) + Robust 401k\n * Hours: 8:30 a.m. 5:00 (preferably Eastern time but flexible)\n * Culture: High-Performance but Humble (no jerks) that Creates Space for Deep Work\n * Personality: Obsessed with Details so We can Simplify the Complex for Others\n \n \nWho is This Opportunity Perfect for? \nA masterful user-focused, problem solving front-end UX developer who might relate to any of these: \nIf youre tired of the commute, sick of burning the midnight oil, stress is dominating your life, and the cost of real estate is eating up your retirement, this is your opportunity to take back control, live life under your own terms and design a lifestyle that brings you joy, happiness and satisfaction. \nOr, if youre frustrated bouncing around from one project to the next, constantly shifting priorities, deadlines that jump from ambiguous to unrealistic, getting lost in spaghetti code from too many cooks in the kitchen or having to clean up other peoples undocumented, poorly written code, this is your opportunity to reclaim your sanity and align yourself with an organization who likes to do things RIGHT. \nOr, if youre drowning in the corporate or agency world, suffocating from lack of clarity, incessant scope creep, micromanaging bosses, endless meetings, constant interruptions and no respect for the quiet time you need to actually get work done, this is your opportunity to simplify and go deep to pour your heart and soul into ONE big opportunity and scale it like never before. \nOr, if youve tried the freelance thing, but found it challenging or simply not fun doing the sales and marketing piece to land new clients so you could provide yourself or your family with a steady income, this is your opportunity find a long-term home with an organization who cares and who will constantly put fun, meaningful and challenging projects on your plate to keep things exciting and interesting. \nRegardless of your situation, whether you prefer to work in the quiet of your own home, sipping a delicious cup of coffee at your favorite coffee shop, or outside enjoying the sunshine on a bright, beautiful day AND you are a humble, high-performing individual who would THRIVE in this type of environment, then please read on, as we cant wait to meet you. \nWho Are We and Whats the Companys Background? \nOur mission is to empower people to thrive EVERY day so they can enjoy life to the fullest. Were doing this by spreading our metabolism-first success framework to a worldwide audience. Its a flexible, fun lifestyle thats 100% focused on consistently getting you the results that matter: looking your best, feeling your best and performing your best. In the shortest time possible. And in a way that sticks. \nIt puts YOU back in control. It helps YOU understand how your body and metabolism works. It empowers YOU to fix your own problems. And because it alleviates the frustration and confusion so many of us experience when trying to fix our health, it makes you want to tell the world about it. \nOur vision is to do this by growing into a billion-dollar multi-channel brand thats distributed via online, mobile and physical retail. For 8 years, weve been painstakingly building the products, services, framework, team and culture to make this happen. And now were scaling into a much larger stage. \nWeve built a full ecosystem of products that allow someone to live a metabolism-first lifestyle. This includes exercise and nutrition programs, nutraceuticals, functional foods, memberships and coaching programs. Were launching a mobile app next year, then will push into offline retail, extend into home-delivered meals and more. But ONE thing at a time, just like weve done for 8 years. \nOur next major step is rolling out our new Metabolic Living brand and centralized e-commerce website at www.metabolicliving.com, scheduled to be live in first half of 2020. We will consolidate into this centralized website our various product-branded microsites like at www.metabolicrenewal.com. \nSo why is a metabolism-first lifestyle needed? Because there are record amounts of sick, overweight, tired and depressed people piling up around the world. Were over-worked, over-stressed, over-fed and full of toxins. And were deprived of the sleep, nutrition, movement and relaxation we need to thrive. \nUnfortunately, the typical solution of extreme dieting and exercise traps people into a 1-step-forward, 2-steps back vicious cycle that makes them worse off. They bounce from one latest flavor-of-the-month program to the next, never making progress trapped in a downward spiral of increasing desperation. \nAnd philosophies like Paleo or Vegan, while extremely healthy for some, create a rigid us-vs-them tribal mentality thats self-limiting. Neither of those philosophies work for all people all the time or even the same person all the time. People differ. Bodies change. If thats not respected, things will backfire. \nThe answer? Instead of trying to FIND the perfect program, people need to CREATE their own one that respects how YOUR body works. And thats where our metabolism-first framework comes in. \nIt empowers you with a repeatable, customizable method to optimize your metabolism. Because weve found through working with millions of people that a fully optimized metabolism is what delivers the results everyone wants feeling their best, looking their best and performing their best, EVERY day. \nSo, instead of fighting against your body and getting inconsistent results with a one-size fits all program or protocol, we teach you to work with your body to enjoy consistent results by building your OWN perfect customized program. One thats practical, enjoyable and sustainable and starts working fast.\n\nBenefits\n\nWhat You'll Enjoy from Us: \n * A Curated Team - A very supportive team of other high-performers who like to get things done, hold themselves accountable and help each other out wherever possible.\n \n \n * A Nurturing Culture - A culture that supports and nurtures your need to learn, grow and challenge yourself to be the best you possibly can be.\n \n \n * A Fantastic Lifestyle A 100% remote experience that allows you to work from home with a lot of flexibility in choosing how you work with us.\n \n \nIf this sounds like a good fit, if youre excited to do something challenging and meaningful that preserves your ability to enjoy life to the fullest, then please apply ASAP as we cant wait to meet you!

Apply

\nWe at Redox understand that we are all patients, and our mission is to make healthcare data useful and every patient experience better. Our values represent the basis of our culture of trust, transparency, and personal growth, and define how we want to interact with each other and the world.\n\nRedox’s full-service integration platform accelerates the development and distribution of healthcare software solutions by securely and efficiently exchanging healthcare data. With just one connection, data can be transmitted across a growing network of more than 500 healthcare delivery organizations and more than 200 independent software vendors. Members of the Redox Network exchange more than seven million patient records per day, leveraging a single data standard compatible with more than 40 electronic health record systems. We are on a path to double our number of client connections over the next year and need to continue to build applications that scale accordingly.\n\nAbout the Team\n\nOur applications provide ingress and egress pathways that are responsive to the communication and data format needs of our customers, all while being resilient to our scaling needs to process millions of records per day. Our engineering teams own their solutions, enjoying the autonomy to design and implement the technical solutions to the hard problems presented by the myriad ways of exchanging healthcare data. \n\nA sampling of the technologies we use to implement these solutions include:\n\n\n* Libraries and µ-services built using TypeScript/NodeJS\n\n* Data management using Postgres, Kafka, and Redis\n\n* Horizontally scalable containerized deployments using Docker, Rancher, and Kubernetes\n\n* Application monitoring using InfluxDB, Grafana, and SumoLogic\n\n\n\n\nAn impactful engineer will:\n\n\n* Collaborate with other team members to continue to scale our architecture, taking into account the needs of today while remaining flexible enough to evolve for the needs of tomorrow\n\n* Work within a µ-service architecture, creating new solutions and decomposing our existing monolith\n\n* Own projects from end to end, executing on designs involving multiple fellow engineers\n\n* Participate in all phases of the SDLC - from requirements, design, and development through testing, deployment, maintenance, and support\n\n* Create RESTful APIs that adhere to best practices, as well as build out tolerant async models of communication\n\n* Understand the tension between an ideal end state and delivering value quickly and effectively prioritize between those options\n\n* Bias towards action while solving the biggest problems in sight\n\n\n\n\nYour day to day will consist of:\n\n\n* Pairing with other team members, embracing a culture of collaboration and mutual respect to solve complex problems\n\n* Designing solutions to feature requirements as prioritized by Product Management\n\n* Implement solutions through the entirety of the SDLC, including testing, deployment, and operationalization\n\n* Create generic solutions to complex problems\n\n* Reviewing fellow engineer’s code prior to shipping\n\n* Troubleshooting production issues as they arise and building a more fault-tolerant system\n\n\n\n\nPreferred Experience\n\n\n* 5+ years professional software development experience in one or more modern general purpose languages (Javascript/Typescript, C#, etc). Your day to day development will be spent working with NodeJS and TypeScript, but we are more interested in your ability to solve problems than the language used to solve those problems.\n\n* Experience writing horizontally scalable applications\n\n* Experience working with relational data stores\n\n* Experience integrating with 3rd party APIs\n\n* Strong desire to expand your professional impact and autonomy\n\n* Healthcare IT\n\n* Excellent written and oral communication skills, including pairing\n\n* Effectively give and receive feedback, both positive and constructive\n\n* Operate effectively on a remote team\n\n* Experience leading a team is a PLUS\n\n\n\n\nIt is not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of the areas outlined above. Please apply even if you are not sure you meet all these criteria. If you are interested in the role and think it could be a fit, we'd like to hear from you.

Iridium Technology


BI Developer Senior Home Office Based

Iridium Technology


dev

senior

digital nomad

dev

senior

digital nomad

16d

Apply

\nBody\n\nDoes this get you excited? \n Working remotely, getting a great salary, flexible hours, and our unlimited vacation policy.  And no commute and no parking problems, because you will be working out of your home office! (Note that if you don't want to work from a home office, we will cover the cost of membership in a co-working environment.)\n  \n About the Role \n Iridium technology is a 10-year old global software firm that thinks it is still a startup.  Our 45+ employees are based around the world, and all working out of home offices.  That's right - we are a 100% virtual company.  We are a premier provider of business intelligence (BI) solutions for law firms. Our company is experiencing rapid growth, and we need to add several BI Developers to our team.  You will be joining an elite group, and we only hire 'spectacular' candidates. We offer excellent salaries, home office-based employment, and a complete benefits package that includes an 'unlimited vacation' policy. \n  \n The position of BI Developer requires candidates with very strong development skills. This is occasionally a client-facing role, so excellent communication skills are also a must. We are looking for applicants who are entrepreneurial, incredibly bright, organized, focused, creative problem solvers, able to work independently, extremely hard-working, and who embrace the home office-based lifestyle.\n \n\n\n \n\n\nJob Responsibilities\n\nThe role encompasses a combination of and development business analyst duties, including: \n\n\n* Requirements gathering and documentation for development projects\n\n* Design, code, deploy, and test Iridium BI product features and enhancements \n\n* Design, code, deploy, and test client-specific customizations and enhancements \n\n* Report/dashboard design and development \n\n* Development of software tools for internal use\n\n* Adhere to all coding and testing processes, and suggest enhancements to our internal processes\n\n* Track down and fix bugs in our products \n\n* Troubleshoot & performance tune our products as required\n\n* Technical investigations \n\n* Support firm infrastructure (network, security, databases, azure, etc.)\n\n* Other tasks/projects assigned – all Iridium team members up to and including the CEO “wear multiple hats”\n\n\n\n\n\nRequired Skills - General\n\n\n* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar. (For the intern position, your degree can be in progress.)\n\n* Excellent written/oral communications skills\n\n* “Iridium DNA” – see below \n\n* Experience with accounting/finance systems and concepts (not required, but a big plus)\n\n\n\n\n\nRequired Skills - Technical\n\n\n* Note: we are hiring for Senior, Graduate, and part-time Intern roles. We expect Senior applicants to have at least 5+ years of experience on some or all of our core technologies.  For Graduates or part-time Interns, experience in our core technologies is considered a plus, but is not required.   \n\n* Our core technologies are listed below. While we prefer experience with these technologies, we will consider developers that are familiar with other technologies - our thinking is that hard-core coders can learn any technology stack. Our technologies are…\n\n* SQL Server (relational database/T-SQL, SSAS multidimensional/MDX, SSAS tabular/DAX, SSRS),\n\n* Ability to design and code mobile applications using tools such as HTML5 and modern JavaScript frameworks. Native mobile application development is a plus.\n\n* HTML5, Angular 7+, Angular JS, C#, JavaScript, TypeScript and others.\n\n* Experience with the new Microsoft Azure and Microsoft BI tools is a plus: Power BI, tabular, machine learning, R/Python, data mining, etc.\n\n* Development experience using Visual Studio and coding in languages including .NET or other server-side technologies\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDeveloper Nirvana and “Iridium DNA”\n\nIridium provides a great environment for developers to learn new technologies and show off their skills.  First of all, this is a company that is run by developers. 35 out of our 40+ employees have degrees in Computer Science or IT. Our CEO even has a degree in Computer Science. We love to code, design architectures, streamline processes, and we relentlessly striving for constant improvement.  We have modern/relevant technology stack, and we are moving aggressively into implementing the Microsoft Azure BI/AI capabilities.  Each developer is assigned to a team with 4-5 members, and collaborative programming and collaborative problem-solving are highly encouraged. You will constantly be challenged to learn new technologies and extend your knowledge of Iridium’s products.  We offer a very agile and empowered environment – if you have a great idea, speak up and present it to the team. If the team loves your idea, then we will look for you to implement it.\n\nIridium is a 10-year old company that thinks it is still a startup.  We have the startup attitude, but also offer stable and long-term employment with a company that has positive cash flow and is not concerned about running out of money.  We offer the start-up mindset, but without the fear that we will close our doors next month.\n\nIf you are looking for a relaxing job where you can work 8-5 Monday through Friday, then this is not the job for you. The Iridium work experience is fast-paced and high intensity. You will be a member of a team of extremely talented and highly skilled technical employees. We all bring our “whatever it takes attitude” to solving both technical and client issues – this is what we refer to as “Iridium DNA”. You will be empowered to showcase your technical skills and grit on a daily basis. You will be given massive responsibility and be expected to independently manage yourself. We can promise overtime, late nights, and even some weekend work. But we can also promise a great sense of achievement, and a supportive team environment that makes it all worthwhile. Are you a hard charger? If so, you will fit right in and you will love working here.\n\nSalary\n\nNegotiable/DOE\n\nBenefits\n\nNegotiable/DOE\n\nWhy Nevada, Arizona, New Mexico, and Texas only?\n\n\n* Those are the states where we already have employees. We want to avoid hiring in new states where we will have to file additional payroll tax reports, etc.  Additionally, we prefer states in the Pacific and Mountain time zones because they can work best with our international team members.\n\n\n

See more jobs at Iridium Technology

\nPosition Description\n\nKing & Union is seeking to hire an experienced and talented Senior Cyber Security Sales Engineer in our fast-paced well-funded start-up. Our flagship product, Avalon, is a threat analytics platform built with collaboration at its core helping build an interactive community of cyber analysts. Avalon provides a dynamic workspace where security operators and analysts can lean in, cut through the noise and reduce the time to address threats from hours to minutes. The platform enables organizations’ users to rapidly collaborate with trusted peers on investigations and findings, providing unique insights, and setting up fast action events for remediation. The Senior Sales Engineer is responsible for providing exceptional pre-sales support to the sales team focusing on public and private sector accounts.\n\nOverview of Position\n\n\n* Assist in driving new business from prospective and existing customer accounts as well as assisting the sales team in meeting and/or exceeding all sales quotas\n\n* Organize, plan, direct, and coordinate all aspects of the technical pre-sales engagement for the prospect\n\n* Serve as business resource to the customer/prospect and provide subject matter expert service and consulting throughout sales cycle\n\n* Proactively drive sales opportunities within identified accounts\n\n* Work with Sales, Marketing, and Product Managers to bridge the gap between the customer and the product contributing to messaging and product enhancements\n\n* Ownership of technical relationships with our pre-sales customers\n\n* Support sales team to accelerate sales cycle as appropriate\n\n\n\n\nRequirements:\n\n\n* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience\n\n* +5 years of experience as a sales engineering or similar consulting role\n\n* Strong understanding of general networking concepts\n\n* Strong understanding of security and information event management (SIEM), SOAR's, TIP's, threat intelligence \n\n* Knowledge of scripting languages like Python/Perl\n\n* Ability to handle Proof of Concept and solution demonstrations\n\n* Self-motivated and strong work ethic\n\n* Clear, concise, confident, and effective communicator\n\n* Exceptional presentation skills and commitment to customer satisfaction\n\n* Background in cybersecurity and relevant industry experience preferred\n\n* Prefer knowledge of threat intelligence landscape including key players in the industry \n\n* Broad contacts in cyber threat intelligence community are a plus \n\n\n\n\nCompensation\n\n\n* Early round shares\n\n* Competitive salary\n\n* 401(k), healthcare, and full benefits\n\n* Ability to work from home and our offices in Old Town, Alexandria\n\n\n

Apply

At Redox our mission is to enable the frictionless adoption of technology in healthcare.\n\nTo that end we have enabled a network of healthcare organizations and technology developers to connect through us to improve patient healthcare. Our customers have asked us to help minimize data duplication for various scenarios. \n\nAn ideal candidate is a data science enthusiast and will solve complex data-related problems, using advanced statistical and machine learning tools, in a real-world setting with product managers and engineers. Candidates should demonstrate strong statistical, mathematical and technical skills, with proven capabilities to transition ideas into fully working projects. In addition, the candidate needs to have a creative and first principles mindset to examine our current processes and help us grow our Data Science muscle at Redox. \n\n\n\n\nWHAT YOU'LL DO:\n\n\n\n\n* Apply advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to build, maintain, and improve multiple real-time decision-making systems – from research to production and deployment\n\n* Collaborate on highly technical projects - from redesigning working infrastructures to maintaining and improving our current models and underlying systems to integrating new technologies to the data science workflow\n\n* Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building our analytical systems\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWHAT WE LOOK FOR:\n\n\n\n\n* Minimum 3-5 years of experience working in data science at a company. \n\n* Experience working with machine learning libraries, for example, Fastai, Numpy, xgboost, sklearn, scipy among others; natural language processing experience is a plus\n\n* Experience with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc) a plus\n\n* Experience in implementing statistical/machine learning algorithms (parametric and non-parametric models, classification and regression trees, Bayesian models, clustering and dimensionality reduction techniques)\n\n* Background in at least one high level programming language (e.g.,Python, R, Java, Javascript)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAbout Redox:\n\nWhat We Do\nHealthcare organizations and technology vendors connect to Redox once, then authorize what data they send to and receive from partners through a centralized hub. Redox's cloud-based platform is vendor and standards agnostic and enables the secure and efficient exchange of healthcare data.\n\nThis approach eradicates the need for point-to-point integrations and accelerates the discovery, adoption, and distribution of patient and provider-facing technology solutions. With hundreds of healthcare organizations and technology vendors exchanging data today, Redox represents the largest interoperable network in healthcare. Learn how you can leverage the Redox platform at www.redoxengine.com.\n\nOther Stuff About Us\nRedox is an EEO company. We fully support the diversity of our team! Here's a recent blog post about our stance on diversity and belonging: Diversity at Redox\n\nWe believe in holding ourselves to a high standard of conduct. Here's how we think about this: Redox Code of Conduct\n\nSuccessful candidates must be eligible to be employed in the US, and must reside in the US.\n\nThank you for your interest in Redox!

We’re looking for someone who can overcome the challenges that come with a startup, do more with less, face a problem head on, automate and streamline our operations…and do it all while consistently resolving issues in our dev, test and production environments. \n\nIf you are a highly energetic self-starter with the ability to work independently in a remote environment, achieve results, focus on the details, and ultimately want to be part of transforming an institutional enterprise then…APPLY HERE! \n\nWHERE YOU WILL BE IN ONE YEAR: \n\n\n* TRANSFORM AN INDUSTRY! - You will be involved in an industry that is unlike any other. You will accelerate your career in half the time while having double the impact on our day to day operations. \n\n\n\n\nWHAT YOU'LL DO TO GET THERE:\n\n\n* Work as part of a small technical team to systems to be highly available, scalable and highly performant.\n\n* Scale infrastructure to meet rapidly increasing demand and improve automated deployments, monitoring, management and incident response.\n\n* Monitor site database stability/performance and troubleshoot issues.\n\n* Collaborate with a team to create and execute load and performance tests.\n\n* Proactively meet standards for information security and compliance.\n\n* Have an attitude to always improve by constantly researching new technologies and services(example: SQL Server on Linux, .NET auto scaling on GCP, etc.)\n\n\n\n\nWHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCEED:\n\n\n* Google Cloud Platform will be the main focus of preferred experience, if you have strong experience in AWS or Azure that will give you a great as TeamCity, Octopus Deploy, VSTS, etc.\n\n* Strong experience managing, monitoring, profiling and scaling Microsoft servers(SQL Server, Windows Server, IIS).\n\n* Strong knowledge and understanding Apply

The Opportunity\nModern Tribe is looking for an experienced Frontend Engineer to join our team.\n\nYou will be responsible for crafting robust, beautiful, usable interfaces for the users of our products and our client‚Äôs projects. You will play an integral role in connecting and collaborating with strategy, design, and backend to creative a cohesive and organized final experience and enthusiastically own getting to the most optimal solution. You thrive working in a collaborative and engaging environment and love being part of teams and systems that actively seek your experience in helping us grow and improve.\n\nYou will use your deep knowledge within HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to solve both simple and complex challenges, both in and outside of the WordPress platform. When paired with your understanding of best practices in accessibility, performance, and architecture, you ultimately produce code and experiences that are scalable and delightful.\n\nIf this sounds like an exciting opportunity to you, read on!\n\n# Responsibilities\n Responsibilities\n* Collaborate with your team to deeply understand the needs of our users and clients and then plan, design, and build features that best serve those needs\n* Take ownership of the work you do on projects from strategy to design to implementation to deployment and maintenance\n* Be an impactful contributor to your team, discipline, and company, participating in our culture and helping us improve and push our internal tools, libraries, workflows, and standards forward\n* Actively participate in team scrum meetings\n* Deliver maintainable, efficient, and high-quality code\n* Build and maintain scalable code\n* Design and build features that are performant, accessible, and steeped in the best practices of modern frontend development standards and patterns\n* Participate in keeping our internal tooling and systems current\n* Ensure that the quality of our design implementation and user experience is the very best it can be (design and development work very closely together at Modern Tribe)\n* Share knowledge and collaborate with fellow developers across the company\n* Code review the work of other developers \n\n# Requirements\n**Personal Competencies**\n* Strong communication skills\n* Experience working as part of a remote team\n* Self-motivated, detail-oriented\n* Strong organizational skills\n* A methodical approach to all tasks\n* Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines\n* Fluent English speaker\n\n**Knowledge & Experience**\n* Exceptional HTML & CSS (including experience with Sass or PostCSS and BEM) skills\n* Mid to advanced level vanilla JavaScript experience (including experience with webpack, babel, and ES2015+ syntax)\n* Experience working with design systems and design system thinking\n* Mid to advanced level experience developing WordPress powered sites\n* Extensive knowledge of modern frontend development standards\n* Proficiency at local environment setups, including docker\n* Proficiency in version control, namely GIT\n* You have experience working in a remote, fast paced, and highly collaborative environment with peers from different backgrounds and skill sets.\n* You pay attention to and are passionate about the details.\n* You take pride in and value team success.\n* You are thoughtful and motivated when it comes to approaching your work. This includes being comfortable with proactively driving feature requirements whether that be identifying gaps and asking questions or helping flesh out additional details.\n\n**Bonus Points**\n* Contributions to the open source community\n* Experience building sites that are accessible (you‚Äôve worked with WAI-ARIA and done WCAG 2.0+ AA/Section 508 work) and performant (working knowledge of best practices)\n* Experience in more advanced areas of JavaScript (state management; async operations; unit, snapshot, and integration testing; REST APIs)\n* Experience with React, Vue, or React Native and Web and/or Native App engineering\n* Full stack experience beyond HTML, CSS, and JavaScript\n* Background working on large scale WordPress projects\n\n**Location**\nWork from anywhere and join our distributed team working across the globe. If your timezone is outside of US business hours, but you work at least 3-4+ hours of overlap each day, let‚Äôs chat. You should be fluent in English and just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily video chats with the Tribe.\n\n**Compensation**\nPay range is commensurate with qualifications and experience between $40-$60/hour. We are currently looking for freelance contractors about 10-20 hours a week for this gig. This is a one time contract position, though we are always seeking longer relationships with awesome people.\n\nModern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.\n\nWe come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80‚Äôs movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.\n\nEveryday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us. \n\n#Salary\n$85,000\n \n\n#Location\n- üåèWorldwide

When applying for jobs, you should NEVER have to pay to apply. That is a scam! Posts that link to pages with "how to work online" are also scams. Don't use them or pay for them. Also always verify you're actually talking to the company in the job post and not an imposter. Scams in remote work are rampant, be careful! \nConvene Engineering is building a technology platform to help humanize the built world, and we need an outstanding Full-Stack Software Engineer working with NodeJS/Express and microservice architectures to join our engineering team. We are creating some of the most beautiful real-world meetings and flexible workplaces to inspire and foster collaboration and engagement. Our engineering projects connect Convene customers with Convene's physical world. \n\nConvene's engineering team strives to deliver solutions that match the high standard of our physical spaces. This role focuses on the full-stack development of Convene products. \n\nReporting to the VP of Engineering, The Lead Software Engineer works closely with the members of the Convene Product and Engineering team. A successful candidate possesses strong problem-solving and analytical skills, is comfortable recommending solutions and technological improvements, is genuine, works with the highest of integrity, and relentlessly pursues success. \n\nResponsibilities\n\n\n* Lead the technical creation and evolution of the Convene's impactful customer-facing products.\n\n* Ensure that the overall application and platform architectures are robust and easy to maintain. \n\n* Collaborate with the companies technology leadership on technology roadmap and overall architecture.\n\n* Be a hands-on leader who manages, mentors, and coaches your technical team members to success. \n\n\n\n\nQualifications\n\n\n* Demonstrated success on an engineering team in a high-growth, highly volatile PE or VC-backed company delivering to large, sophisticated enterprise customers.\n\n* Seven plus years of full-stack development using popular languages and frameworks such as NodeJS, Java, Ruby, and React.\n\n* Experienced in managing cross-functional engineering teams, including mobile and front-end.\n\n* Minimum of two years of direct NodeJS development, methodologies, and configuration.\n\n* Daily responsibility with building out a microservice architecture using NodeJS and cloud services like AWS, Azure\n\n* Experience conducting code reviews and mentoring team members in an Agile process.\n\n\n\n\nPersonal Characteristics\n\n\n* You are engineering obsessed and devoted to getting it right and getting it done. \n\n* You are in love with change and enjoy being in a high-growth environment that is rapidly scaling.\n\n* You are comfortable with ambiguity and can carve out a path to a solution, using your skill and intuition to make quick and confident decisions in this high-growth context.\n\n* You are a person who always finds ways to help others on the team to learn, develop, and continually improve.\n\n\n\n\nAbout Convene \n\nConvene designs and services premium places to work, meet, and host inspiring events. Through strategic partnerships with prominent commercial landlords, Convene operates a network of hospitality-driven locations in Class A office buildings across major U.S. cities, with plans to expand globally. Convene has raised $260M in equity funding to date and has been named one of America’s 100 Most Promising Companies by Forbes and a Best Workplace by both Inc. and Fortune Magazine.\n\nOther recent accolades include:\n\n\n* 2017-2019 Certified Great Place to Work®.\n\n* 2018 Fortune Best Small & Medium Workplaces U.S.\n\n* #11 Workplace in New York in 2017 by Fortune Magazine.\n\n* #30 in 2017 LinkedIn List of Most In-Demand Startups.\n\n\n\n\nIn everything we do, we strive to put the people we do it for first. This starts internally: we believe our values drive behaviors to create culture. Together we’re building a culture that embraces diversity and learning, humility and gratitude. At the same time, we try not to take ourselves too seriously and strive for a healthy integration between work and personal pursuits. \n\nBenefits you can expect as a Convene employee\n\n\n* Supportive work environment and leaders who are focused on your professional growth.\n\n* Generous professional development policy that includes funds earmarked for each employee's discretionary professional growth. Have a conference you want to attend? A class you want to take? If it's helping take your career to the next level, we support it. Each employee is required to have 65 hours of learning per year.\n\n* Flexible PTO and family leave.\n\n* 401k match.\n\n* Excellent health coverage for team members and their families.\n\n* Company events that highlight our team's passions and hobbies.\n\n* Healthy snacks.\n\n\n\n\nConvene is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives.

\nStartup seeking like-minded Sales Engineer! PacketFabric redefines how companies procure and manage their network connectivity. The technical team is a small, talented, and close knit group. We have a bond formed from the love of running head long at difficult problems and finding highly effective solutions.\n\n\n\nDescription\n\nAs a well rounded Sales Engineer, you should definitely be the type that appreciates diversity in your day, and challenges outside of your comfort level! You will be working with customers, the development team, the network team, and the sales team to ensure all operations flow smoothly and customer satisfaction is at 100%.\n\nA typical day in the life of a PacketFabric Sales Engineer might include these types of activities:\n\n\n* Collaborate with Account Directors to architect PacketFabric service solutions in support of a prospects’ needs and requirements as it pertains to network connectivity between locations, to Cloud Service Providers and other parties within the PacketFabric ecosystem.\n\n* Lead technical discovery meetings to determine a prospect’s requirements and business hurdles.\n\n* Demonstrate the PacketFabric user portal or API.\n\n* Contribute your expertise to PacketFabric’s growing Knowledge Base.\n\n* Working with customers to get ordered services provisioned and ensure they understand software features and billing.\n\n* Performing credit/background/industry checks to validate new customer signup status and activating new accounts in a timely fashion.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSkills & Requirements\n\n\n\n* Background in network operations and/or software development with a focus on infrastructure automation.\n\n* Candidate should have experience with and understanding of routing protocols (IS-IS, BGP, MPLS), common network designs, and best practices found in enterprise and cloud networks.\n\n* Clear and concise verbal and written communication skills.\n\n* Excellent proficiency with Word, Excel, and other office suite applications.\n\n* Ability to learn new software tools with minimal training and gain true proficiency with the PacketFabric software tools.\n\n* Willing to travel 10% of the time.\n\n* Experience deploying and running infrastructure on multiple cloud environments preferred.\n\n\n

\nHealthPrize is hiring a Senior Platform Engineer\n\nAt HealthPrize, we are changing the way people think about their medication and their health!\n\nIf you are seeking more passion than red tape, an environment where hard work is rewarded with great opportunity, and where an entrepreneurial mindset is essential, then HealthPrize may be the place for you!\n\nOur growth is being fueled by work with leading brands in life sciences such as Abbott, Walgreens, and Gilead. Join the close-knit engineering team that designs and develops our industry leading patient engagement platform. Hone your skills in an agile, collaborative environment and work with us to measurably improve the state of healthcare globally.\n\nThe Role\n\nWe are looking for self-motivated engineers to join our team to help take our platform to the next level. At HealthPrize, Senior Platform Engineers have a deep understanding of progressive web application fundamentals and the back-end architecture required to power a suite of globally distributed apps. They consistently deliver large features that provide significant value to our customers. They collaborate well with others, seek input from teammates, and provide detailed code reviews.\n\nWe are polyglots at heart, and like to use the right tools for the job. Currently, our core technologies include Java, Kotlin, Aurora/MySQL, Spring-Boot & the broader Spring Framework ecosystem, Docker, Redis, ElasticSearch and all the goodness on Amazon Web Services. Our platform is fully deployed on AWS in a highly secure environment that we manage & operate.\n\nAs a successful candidate, you:\n\n\n* Love to deliver useful software and respond to feedback from the people who use it\n\n* Have strong experience as a professional developer working with a distributed team\n\n* Are passionate about shipping code that is scalable, maintainable and well-tested\n\n* Are fluent in the Java and/or Kotlin language and can reason about the JRE\n\n* Can successfully communicate with internal and external stakeholders to resolve operational concerns & customer issues\n\n* Enjoy optimizing complex data models for understandability and performance\n\n* Are not dogmatic in your technology choices, but have the passion and knowledge to engage in debates about various tooling and technologies\n\n* Have experience designing, implementing, and maintaining APIs as a service for your team and customers\n\n* Are familiar with our open source stack and associated tooling\n\n* Have experience deploying and operating services-oriented platforms on AWS infrastructure\n\n* Are interested in building a reliable, fault-tolerant, multi-tenant platform and delivering it to a global user base\n\n\n\n\n\nAbout HealthPrize\n\nLocated in South Norwalk, CT, HealthPrize Technologies is the pioneer in the use of gamification, behavioral economics, and consumer marketing concepts to engage and motivate patients. Programs developed on our platform are used by life science companies to inspire brand loyalty, improve health literacy, and maximize medication adherence.\n\nMany companies say they are entrepreneurial, but we really are, and are looking for people who are ready to contribute and make an immediate impact. We are in the midst of an exciting period of growth as we expand the number of programs developed on our platform and are seeking smart, hard-working, and self-directed individuals who can thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.\n\nWhile we are focused on solving serious health problems, we don’t take ourselves too seriously. If you like to work hard and have fun doing it, you’ll fit right in. Our offices are within walking distance to dozens of restaurants, bars, and coffee shops, and are just one block from the waterfront.\n\nHealthPrize is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. HealthPrize also expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on any of the above.

20d

Apply

\nSystemOne is a connected diagnostics and disease intelligence company that is committed to improving clinical care in low and middle income countries. We are improving lives via SystemOne's Aspect platform which moves data from millions of real-time HIV and Tuberculosis diagnostic tests in 42 countries and the pace is accelerating. We’ve facilitated unprecedented volumes and quality of data to measure disease outbreaks, patient care, and the utilization of equipment and reagents. We are now looking to support countries as they unlock the incredible value of these data in their health system through our data use program.\n\nResponsibilities\n\n\n\nAs a Front-End Engineer at SystemOne, you will build front ends for our web and mobile applications, Aspect and Aspect Reporter. You will be a key member of the team, making technical decisions that will shape the company’s future. We are looking for people who love to code and work with other engineers to build meaningful products. Specifically, you will:\n\n\n* Build UIs that present actionable information to health professionals\n\n* Scout the latest developments in front-end technologies and help the team select the best tools\n\n* Optimize UI performance for low-resource settings\n\n\n\n\nWhat is it like to work at SystemOne?\n\nThe software development culture at SystemOne can be summarized as "ship quickly":\n\n\n* We try to remove unnecessary processes from our product pipeline\n\n* We do not to over-engineer our software\n\n\n\n\nQuality and knowledge sharing are important:\n\n\n* Every patch to any software is met with a code review in GitHub\n\n* We write tests to cover brittle and error prone areas of our software\n\n\n\n\nThe day to day:\n\n\n* You will be part of a distributed team of seven engineers located in the Americas, Africa, and Europe\n\n* We use Scrum to plan our work and we work in two week sprints\n\n* Because we work in very different time zones, you will have a great amount of flexibility when it comes to working hours and organizing your day, but we do have a daily standup meeting in which everyone participates\n\n* The team hierarchy is flat - all members contribute to discussions about how we organize our work and everyone writes code, including our CTO\n\n\n\n\nWe are looking for people with:\n\n\n* A product-first approach to building software. You care about the real world functionality of your work\n\n* At least five years of professional software development experience building, deploying, and maintaining web applications and mobile apps\n\n* Several years of experience with React, React Native, or other front-end frameworks like Angular or Vue\n\n* Deep understanding of mobile user-interface and user-experience concepts and design\n\n* Extensive knowledge of JavaScript\n\n* A passion for working as part of a team\n\n* Experience in optimizing applications for low powered devices is a plus\n\n\n\n\nCandidates must embrace SystemOne's Core values:\n\n\n* Do good and create lasting value;\n\n* Make the journey matter;\n\n* Be worthy of respect;\n\n* Be pragmatic and keep it simple.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTechnology\n\n\n\nFrom a technology standpoint, our software is heterogeneous. We currently use the following technologies:\n\nFront-End:\n\n\n* React/Redux\n\n* React Native\n\n* Jest\n\n* Enzyme\n\n* ...\n\n\n\n\nBack-End:\n\n\n* Windows Server\n\n* Ubuntu Server\n\n* MySQL\n\n* NodeJS\n\n* RabbitMQ\n\n* Python\n\n* ASP.NET MVC\n\n* AWS (EC2, RDS, VPC, IoT)\n\n* Ansible\n\n\n\n\nLocation:\n\nWe have offices located in Northampton, MA and Johannesburg, South Africa. This is a remote position and we are looking for candidates from the Americas, Africa, and Europe in order to keep the time difference manageable for the team. 

See more jobs at SystemOne

Apply

\nAs a Ruby Architect with OutMatch, you will design the software architecture for Web-based and Mobile friendly SaaS applications built primarily on a Ruby-on-Rails-based technology. You will have the opportunity to be part of a world-class architecture team which is chartered with architecting and designing our next generation products, by maintaining high standards of architecture and design principles, establishing best-in-class patterns and practices, and leading small agile development teams in the implementation of the architecture you designed!\n\n What You’ll Do:\n\n\n* Design the software architecture for service-oriented web-based and Mobile web-based SaaS applications using a technology stack made primarily of ReactJs, Ruby-on-Rails, and MongoDB.\n\n* Participate in the establishment of architecture and design patterns and best practices as part of the OutMatch software architecture team.\n\n* Mentor tech leads and other developers in establishing and applying best-in-class practices for design, coding, continuous integration, and code deployments through design sessions, code reviews, knowledge shares, and technical oversight during sprints.\n\n* Participate in the full software development lifecycle of applications and features by helping small agile development teams navigate requirements, testing and performance testing, technical vision implementation and bug troubleshooting and resolution.\n\n* Evaluate third party software and components for adoption into the Outmatch Platform.\n\n* Engage with the entire IT organization in the continuous improvement of the full SDLC and DevOps tools and processes.\n\n* Solve complex technical problems and design state-of-the-art solutions to address these problems.\n\n* Have the opportunity to learn other technology stacks,\n\n\n\n\n… and most importantly, you will immerse into a culture of collaboration, contribution, and fun!\n\nWhat You’ll Need:\n\n\n* 2-3+ years’ experience architecting and designing web-based and service-oriented applications (REST).\n\n* 5+ years of strong experience implementing solutions with Ruby-on-Rails.\n\n* Strong understanding of database design and concepts. Experience with MongoDB a plus.\n\n* Strong understanding of the philosophy and purpose of MVVM front-end frameworks (React, Angular, Vue, etc.) and when and how to use them.\n\n* Strong abstract & conceptual thinking skills.\n\n* Strong understanding of object-oriented and object-centered design and programming.\n\n* Experience with devOps concepts and continuous integration tools including setting up builds and deployments to web and database servers.\n\n* Solid understanding of database design, implementation and interaction from code.\n\n* Excellent communication, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.\n\n* Familiarity with video recording and streaming a plus.\n\n* Experience working with remote/offshore team members a plus.\n\n\n\n\nWhat You'll Get:\n\n\n* A solid, experienced management team\n\n* A comprehensive training program that enables you to be successful, quickly\n\n\n\n\n\n* A clear path for career growth in our industry-leading organization\n\n* A world-class product with an elegant user interface that empowers our clients to positively impact their business results\n\n* A competitive base salary and great incentive program\n\n* Monthly connectivity allowance\n\n* A new, state-of-the-art office with free parking and fitness center\n\n* Discretionary paid time off. When you need it, take it\n\n* Business casual dress\n\n* We pay 100% of our employee’s medical, dental and vision insurance\n\n* 401(k) with company match\n\n* Employee Stock Option Program\n\n\n\n\n Voted one of Dallas Business Journal's Best Places to Work, OutMatch is transforming the world of work by helping great companies like Adidas, Panera Bread, American Airlines and HCA match people with purpose. Our software predicts employee success on the job and measures fit with a company’s unique CultureDNA™, so companies hire the right people—the absolute best match—and develop them into premier employees who drive improved customer satisfaction and increased revenue.   \n\n Apply today to join a dynamic team dedicated to matching people with purpose!\n\n We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

See more jobs at OutMatch

When applying for jobs, you should NEVER have to pay to apply. That is a scam! Posts that link to pages with "how to work online" are also scams. Don't use them or pay for them. Also always verify you're actually talking to the company in the job post and not an imposter. Scams in remote work are rampant, be careful! When clicking on the button to apply above, you will leave Remote OK and go to the job application page for that company outside this site. Remote OK accepts no liability or responsibility as a consequence of any reliance upon information on there (external sites) or here.

Radish Lab

 

Full Stack Web Developer With React Ruby Docker Experience

Full Stack Web Developer With React Ruby Docker Experience  


Radish Lab


react

full stack

docker

dev

react

full stack

docker

dev

20d

Apply

Immediate need to debug project using Ruby on Rails and Docker\n\nLooking for an individual who is very experienced in React, Ruby on Rails, database migration, and Docker.\n\nThis is an existing project that needs someone to figure out existing, difficult roadblocks... with potential for continued work on the site.\n\n- - -\n\nYour work will be centered on the development of a large-scale web application built with Ruby on Rails, Docker, Webpack, and React with a custom CMS and PostgreSQL database.\n\nYou'll be tasked with writing both back-end and front-end application code to build out the site, add features and functionality, debug, and oversee all new development.\n\nCandidates should be comfortable on either end of the tech stack, adept at complex problem-solving, and able to hit the ground running as the primary developer on a project.\n\n—Responsibilities—\n• Writing maintainable, modular front-end code in React.\n• Using and refining front-end build scripts using Webpack.\n• Writing back-end code in Ruby for a Ruby on Rails server-side web application framework.\n• Managing a Docker Container and configuration for multi-tier development environment.\n• Working with PostgreSQL database and related back-end technologies.\n• Following Git and GitHub best practices to maintain a clean and well documented, version-controlled codebase and managing issues and milestones on deadline.\n• Overseeing all project DevOps such as code deployments on regular sprint cycles and build script configurations.\n• Our staging and production servers are both hosted on AWS EC2 instances so responsibilities will include maintaining those hosting environments which run Docker with an Nginx reverse proxy for handling incoming requests.\n\n—Requirements—\n• At least three years of experience as a full-stack web developer working with Ruby and React, end-to-end.\n• Deep expertise and understanding of modern web development technologies and concepts such as HTML, CSS/SASS, JavaScript, APIs, cross-browser compatibility, accessibility, and mobile-first web development.\n• Proficiency with Rails-based content management systems and authorization systems.\n• Understanding of relational database systems, object-oriented programming, and cloud computing services.\n• Hands-on experience with the AWS ecosystem and maintaining unmanaged servers.\n• Comfort with the terminal, running command-line based utilities, and shell scripting (e.g. Bash).\n• Excellent communication skills in both verbal and written English.\n• Proven success in a lead developer role.
